articles.author: Steve Holland, James Mackenzie
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden on Friday laid out what he described as a three-phase Israeli proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza in return for the release of Israeli hostages, saying "it's time for this war to end" and winning a positive initial reaction from Hamas.
articles.title: Biden unveils new Gaza truce proposal, Hamas responds positively

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Helen Coster, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Donald Trump said on Friday he would appeal the guilty verdict that made him the first U.S. president convicted of a crime, though he will have to wait until after his sentencing on July 11 before taking that step.
articles.title: Trump says he will appeal historic conviction

articles.author: Bate Felix, Alexander Winning
articles.description: South African political parties geared up for coalition talks on Friday as the governing African National Congress (ANC) looked set to fall well short of a majority in this week's election, the first time this has happened in 30 years of democracy.
articles.title: South Africa heads for coalition as ANC set for big fall

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces have ended combat operations in the Jabalia area of north Gaza after destroying more than 10 kilometres of tunnels during days of intense fighting that included over 200 air strikes, the military said on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli military says combat in part of north Gaza is over

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Ma Zhaoxu urged the United States to refrain from "smearing" China and to stop imposing "abusive" sanctions on Chinese companies at talks this week in Washington, China's foreign ministry said on Friday.
articles.title: Chinese vice foreign minister urged US to stop 'smearing' China, Beijing says

articles.author: Jatindra Dash
articles.description: At least 33 people, including election officials on duty, died of suspected heatstroke in India's states of Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Odisha on Friday, and the heatwave in the region is expected to continue until Saturday, authorities said.
articles.title: India heatwave kills at least 33, including election officials

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The leaders of the U.S. Senate and House of Representatives on Friday invited Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to address a joint meeting of Congress, a show of support amid partisan divides over Israel's campaign in Gaza.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu gets invitation to address US Congress
Blinken discusses Gaza plan with Turkey, Jordan and Saudi Arabia

articles.author: Saadeq Ahmed
articles.description: Convicted Canadian serial killer Robert Pickton died on Friday aged 74 after he was assaulted by another inmate in a maximum-security prison earlier this month, prison authorities said.
articles.title: Canadian serial killer Robert Pickton dies after prison attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian Islamist group Hamas on Friday said it had a positive view of the contents of a three-phase ceasefire proposal announced by U.S. President Joe Biden for a permanent ceasefire in Gaza.
articles.title: Hamas says it 'positively' views Gaza ceasefire proposal set out by Biden
